title: Cross Game
resume: Kō Kitamura, whose family owns a sporting goods store, has known the Tsukishima  girls since he was born. The Tsukishima family runs a batting center and  cafe, and they have four daughters. There's Ichiyo, the responsible  eldest; Wakaba, Kō's cheerful best friend; Aoba, who doesn't get along  with Kō; and Momiji, the energetic youngest daughter.  During the summer of their fifth grade, Wakaba leaves for camp after  making a promise with Kō to go to the summer festival when she gets  back. But she dies in an accident while at camp, and Kō goes to the  summer festival by himself in mourning.  When Kō enters high school, he aspires to lead his baseball team to the  Koshien National High Schol Championship as their ace pitcher and make  Wakaba's last dream come true.
